text: A One Day International (ODI) is an international cricket match between two teams, each having ODI status, as determined by the International Cricket Council. The women's variant of the game is similar to the men's version, with minor modifications to umpiring and pitch requirements. The first women's ODI was played in 1973, between England and Australia. At the 1973 and 1982 Women's Cricket World Cup, an "International XI" featured, including the best players from around the world that were not already appearing for their country in the tournament.
